instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Bklt.
threads.message:
Hi, 

I have a 3330 with no bklt. External Screen works with screen unplugged. No history. Older machine, very faint corrosion around the board, nothing major anywhere, especially along LCDBKLT circuit.
J9000
Pins 2,3=3.3V
Pins 38,39,40 (<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>) reads 25V. I believe this is supposed to be 50v for the 15" 
Any idea what could cause the bklt to read low?

This is a mid 2012 model.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Bklt.
threads.message:
Do you get image for sure (on internal LCD), just missing backlight?
PRAM reset done?
<CAPACITOR>C9797</CAPACITOR>/99 both OK, good solders?
Post L9701 voltage.
Do you note any change at <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> pressing backlight control keys?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Bklt.
threads.message: 25 is slightly low. If PRAM reset doesn't fix it, likely an issue with or around the LED driver.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Bklt.
threads.message: As it turns out, its the LCD cable... and of course this is an "up behind the LCD" model so the whole screen has to be changed out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Bklt.
